section.p: The predefined entry fields in dictionaries are only examples of possible fields you can use when you create a new dictionary and determine its structure.
You can add your own user-defined fields to any of the four levels that make up the dictionary structure.
You can only add user-defined fields when you create a new dictionary. When the dictionary already exists, you cannot change its structure.

section.title: Prerequisites
section.p: Decide which dictionary entry fields you want to add to your dictionary structure.

section.title: Calling sequence

ol.li: Yes… next to the Change entry fields option in the New Dictionary window
An entry field belonging to the level to which you want to add a field

section.p: The Add Entry Field window is displayed.

section.title: Options and parameters
section.p: Type a name for the entry field you want to add in the Displayed as field. Click Add to add the new field to your structure.

section.title: Results
section.p: The entry field is added to the dictionary structure at the same level as the entry field you have selected before clicking Add field…. You are returned to the Change Entry Fields window.
